parse: Verb - Present Imperative Middle or Passive - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To pray, pray for, offer prayer. From pros and euchomai; to pray to God, i.e. Supplicate, worship.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Flight, fleeing. From pheugo; a fleeing, i.e. Escape.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
From a derivative of cheo, meaning a storm; by implication, the rainy season, i.e. Winter.
And not, not even, neither?nor. From me and de; but not, not even; in a continued negation, nor.
